Primary Contact: Melba Reid, Vice-Coordinator, Coordinator Basic Training Program 2018; Phone: 778.214.7878; Email: mastergardenerscourse@gmail.com
Service Details: - Provides horticultural advice in the Southern Interior, from Osoyoos to Enderby while educating gardening public on environmentally responsible practices and sharing knowledge through traditional clinics at nurseries and plant sales, or through community projects at notable public and community gardens- Affiliated with the Guisachan Heritage Garden in Kelowna- Makes presentations on gardening issues, writes garden advice columns for newspapers and newsletters, is involved in horticultural therapy activities at extended care facilities and hospices, participates in and some times leads community horticultural beautification projects, and judges gardening events
How to Apply: Please email for information regarding the Master Gardener Program or if interested in volunteering at the Guisachan House garden
Meetings: 12-week university level training program begins on Sat, Sep 2018 and runs through to Sat, Dec, 2018
